column4: hi one question:how can i unistall virtualbox 3(from the website) from my ubuntu-gnome system?
add virtual box repo and use apt-get
can't you use apt-get
tried apt-get but didnt work: couldnt find it
coool, then do it manually using dpkg
seems you installed it manually, right?
ok what is that?
right
dpkg -r virtualbox-3 ...something like this prefix sudo if required
does that make sense?
what this command exacly does?
it erases/removes the packages manually...
keep in mind its not going to remove other dependencies...so avoid using this manual technique as far as possible..use apt-get
ill give it try and then get back to you thnx
i used the same methond to remove my vbox2.2 2 days back...so rest assured you dont need any dependencies to be taken care of...so its fine. just go ahead and remove it manually
no probs
probs?
tried it and gave this message: "dpkg - warning: ignoring request to remove virtualbox which isn't installed"
first get the complete pkg name useing this: dpkg -l | grep -i virtualbox
seems you put wrong/incomplete name hence that message
did you try that?
yes and then tried it apt-get remove with the correct name and worked many thanks
cool....you're welcome
